DataElement.preferredName: Concomitant Medication Receive Investigational New Drug Administration Known Hazard Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria Code Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A response to determine eligibility for clinical trial participation as outlined in the study protocol for questions related to the use of concomitant medications with known hazards regarding the administration of the investigational study drug.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Concomitant Medication Receive Investigational New Drug Administration Known Hazard Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Accessory, accompanying especially in a subordinate or incidental way, occurring or existing during the same period of time._A drug product that contains one or more active and/or inactive ingredients; it is intended to treat, prevent or alleviate the symptoms of disease. This term does not refer to the individual ingredients that make up the product._To take, accept, or get something offered._In the process of being studied; experimental._Having no previous example or precedent or parallel; of a kind not seen before._The act of the dispensing, applying, or tendering of something to another, such as administration of a medicine._Recognized, familiar, or within the scope of knowledge._A source of danger or risk._Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

Concepts.definition: Accessory, accompanying especially in a subordinate or incidental way, occurring or existing during the same period of time.

Property.preferredName: Medication Receive Investigational New Administration Known Hazard Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
Property.preferredDefinition: A drug product that contains one or more active and/or inactive ingredients; it is intended to treat, prevent or alleviate the symptoms of disease. This term does not refer to the individual ingredients that make up the product.:To take, accept, or get something offered.:In the process of being studied; experimental.:Having no previous example or precedent or parallel; of a kind not seen before.:The act of the dispensing, applying, or tendering of something to another, such as administration of a medicine.:Recognized, familiar, or within the scope of knowledge.:A source of danger or risk.:Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

Concepts.definition: A drug product that contains one or more active and/or inactive ingredients; it is intended to treat, prevent or alleviate the symptoms of disease. This term does not refer to the individual ingredients that make up the product.
To take, accept, or get something offered.
In the process of being studied; experimental.
Having no previous example or precedent or parallel; of a kind not seen before.
The act of the dispensing, applying, or tendering of something to another, such as administration of a medicine.
Recognized, familiar, or within the scope of knowledge.
A source of danger or risk.
Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Indicator to represent a response of Yes, No, or Not Applicable._The affirmative response to a question or activity._The non-affirmative response to a question._Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context._A system of numbered categories for representation of data.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.:The non-affirmative response to a question.:Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context.:A system of numbered categories for representation of data.:An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.
The non-affirmative response to a question.
Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.
A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.

An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: Created to support Theradex design of CRFs for NCI CCR trials

ReferenceDocuments.name: Is patient currently receivin
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is patient currently receiving any medication known to induce central serous chorioretinopathy which in the opinion of the Principal Investigator, would make the administration of study drug hazardous?
